item.title: <strong>丹尼尔-耶金谈能源转型发生了什么</strong
item.description:
为什么你不再经常听到 "零净排放 "的说法

？【原文：

Why you don't hear as much about Net Zero anymore.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：丹尼尔-耶金谈 "净零 "的下场（播客）
item.description: 几年前，各国政府和企业对在应对气候变化的努力中实现净零排放的前景充满乐观。如今，你听到的这种说法已经少了很多。虽然可再生能源不断增加，但真正蓬勃发展的能源是天然气。煤炭也在蓬勃发展。到底发生了什么？世界是否有望重回正轨？在本期节目中，我们将与著名能源历史学家丹尼尔-耶金（Daniel Yergin）对话。【原文：A few years ago, governments and corporations were brimming with optimism about the prospect of getting to net zero in the efforts against climate change. Today, you hear a lot less about that. And while there’s renewables getting added to the mix all the time, one energy source that’s really booming is natural gas. And coal is booming too. So what happened? And is there any prospect of the world getting back on track? On this episode, we speak with acclaimed energy historian Daniel Yergin, curr】

item.title: 欧元区商业活动意外创 2024 年以来新高
item.description: 欧元区的商业活动出乎意料地达到了 2024 年 5 月以来的最高水平，因为德国的出色表现帮助抵消了法国的疲软。【原文：Business activity in the euro area unexpectedly reached its highest level since May 2024 as outperformance by Germany helped offset weakness in France.】

item.title: 铜价逼近 11,000 美元，考验历史新高的时刻即将来临
item.description: 在需求普遍乐观的情况下，铜矿事故接连发生，人们担心供应问题，铜价再次冲上每吨 11,000 美元，逼近去年创下的纪录。【原文：Copper headed toward a fresh test of $11,000 a ton, closing in on a record set last year, on concerns about supplies following a spate of mine mishaps at a time of broad optimism over demand.】

item.title: 加密货币交易商避开阿尔特币，打开 8000 亿美元缺口
item.description: 加密货币交易市场通常分为两个主要组成部分：比特币和所谓的另类币（altcoins），后者或多或少涵盖了其他所有代币。【原文：The crypto trading market is often divided into two main constituents: Bitcoin and so-called altcoins, which covers more or less every other token.】

item.title: Qualitas 基金出资 32.5 亿欧元瞄准可再生能源交易
item.description: 西班牙投资基金 Qualitas Energy 开始为新基金募集 32.5 亿欧元（38 亿美元）资金，押注欧洲清洁能源行业的整合浪潮。【原文：Spanish investment fund Qualitas Energy is betting on a wave of consolidation in Europe’s clean-energy sector as it starts raising €3.25 billion ($3.8 billion) for a new fund.】

item.title: 拿破仑钻石胸针首次参加拍卖会
item.description: 拿破仑-波拿巴曾拥有过一枚独特的钻石胸针，据说这枚胸针是从滑铁卢战役的混乱中打捞出来的。【原文：A unique diamond brooch once owned by Napoleon Bonaparte — and said to have been retrieved from the chaos of the Battle of Waterloo — will go under the hammer for the first time this November.】

item.title: 德国商业活动意外创 2023 年以来最大增幅
item.description: 德国私营部门活动出人意料地跃升至 2023 年 5 月以来的最高水平，使这个欧洲最大的经济体在第四季度伊始就站稳了脚跟。【原文：German private-sector activity unexpectedly jumped to its highest level since May 2023, putting Europe’s biggest economy on a firm footing at the start of the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 中国将在香港出售高达 40 亿美元的主权债券
item.description: 中国计划在香港出售多达 40 亿美元的美元政府债券，此举有助于在离岸市场建立更可靠的收益率曲线。【原文：China plans to sell up to $4 billion dollar-denominated government bonds in Hong Kong, a move that can help create a more reliable yield curve in the offshore market.】

item.title: 法国私营部门因政治动荡意外萎缩
item.description: 法国私营部门意外萎缩，预算争论延长了欧洲第二大经济体的财政不确定性。【原文：France’s private sector unexpectedly contracted as wrangling over the budget prolonged fiscal uncertainty for Europe’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 投资者权衡高市讲话，日元表现逊于 G-10 同行
item.description: 周五，日元延续跌势，表现逊于十国集团中的其他国家，原因是日本新任领导人向国会表示，她将奉行战略性和负责任的扩张性财政政策。【原文：The yen extended declines on Friday, underperforming its Group-of-10 peers, as Japan’s new leader told the nation’s parliament she would pursue expansive fiscal policy that was strategic and responsible.】

item.title: 中国力求保持 "合理 "增长，提高消费份额
item.description: 一位高级官员表示，中国政府在起草下一个五年发展蓝图时，将寻求保持一定的增长速度，并扩大消费在经济中的比重。【原文：China will seek to maintain a certain rate of growth and expand consumption’s share of the economy as authorities draft the next five-year development blueprint, a senior official said.】

item.title: 韩美在 3,500 亿美元现金承诺问题上仍存在 "巨大 "分歧
item.description: 韩国工业部长金正昆（Kim Jung-kwan）周五表示，韩国和美国在3500亿美元投资承诺的现金部分上仍然存在 "尖锐 "分歧，暗示可能无法在首脑会谈前及时达成协议。【原文：South Korea and the US remain “sharply” divided over the cash portion of a $350 billion investment pledge, South Korea’s Industry Minister Kim Jung-kwan said Friday, hinting that a deal may not be reached in time for a summit meeting.】

item.title: 替代俄罗斯石油的热潮导致超级油轮运价飙升
item.description: 在美国制裁俄罗斯两大石油生产商后，超级油轮运费期货飙升，刺激原油买家寻求替代品。【原文：Supertanker freight futures have soared after the US’s sanctioning of two major Russian oil producers spurred buyers of the crude to seek alternatives.】

item.title: 前德国央行行长韦伯在工作震荡中警告 "人工智能贵族
item.description: 德国联邦银行前行长阿克塞尔-韦伯（Axel Weber）警告说，人工智能即将带来的破坏可能会导致新的全球精英阶层的崛起，他们会从尖端技术的应用中获得不相称的利润，而让其他人的境况更糟。【原文：Former Bundesbank chief Axel Weber has warned the coming disruption from artificial intelligence could usher in the rise of a new global elite that profits disproportionately from the adoption of the cutting-edge technology while leaving the rest worse off.】

item.title: 瑞信整合接近尾声，瑞银领导层重组
item.description: 随着瑞士信贷的整合接近尾声，瑞银集团重新调整了领导层，副主席 Lukas Gaehwiler 决定在 4 月份的下一次股东大会上退休。【原文：UBS Group AG reshuffled its leadership as the integration of Credit Suisse nears its completion and Vice-Chairman Lukas Gaehwiler decided to retire at the next general meeting in April.】

item.title: 英国零售销售再次增长，意外提振经济
item.description: 英国零售销售连续第四个月意外增长，在近期数据显示经济和就业市场降温之后带来了一线希望。【原文：UK retail sales unexpectedly grew for a fourth straight month, providing a glimmer of hope after recent data pointed to a cooling economy and jobs market.】

item.title: 受美国关税影响，印度 10 月经济增长势头放缓
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的一项速报调查显示，10月份印度整体经济活动放缓，原因是美国提高关税生效后，服务业增速放缓，新订单需求疲软。【原文：India’s overall economic activity slowed in October as services lost pace and demand for new orders softened after higher US tariffs took effect, a flash survey by HSBC Holdings Plc showed.】

item.title: 英国九月份零售销售意外增长
印度信实公司在俄罗斯制裁后抢购中东石油
item.description: 在华盛顿制裁两家俄罗斯生产商后，印度信实工业有限公司从中东和美国购买了数百万桶原油，引发了人们对石油流通中断的担忧。【原文：India’s Reliance Industries Ltd. has bought millions of barrels of crude from the Middle East and US after Washington sanctioned two Russian producers, raising concerns about a disruption to oil flows.】

item.title: 土耳其投资者等待法院对主要反对党的判决
item.description: 周五，土耳其投资者正等待法院对主要反对党命运的另一项判决，这一案件可能再次加剧该国的政治紧张局势。【原文：Investors in Turkey are awaiting yet another court verdict on the fate of the main opposition party on Friday, in a case that could once again escalate political tensions in the country.】

item.title: Blackstone 投资 7.06 亿美元，获得印度联邦银行 10% 的股份
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 在向印度联邦银行注资约 7.06 亿美元后，将成为该银行的最大股东。【原文：Blackstone Inc. will become the largest shareholder in India’s Federal Bank after injecting about $706 million into the lender.】

item.title: 法拉奇提出罢免贝利，表明他将插手英国央行事务
item.description: 奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）暗示，如果他成为首相，他将撤换英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey），这表明如果他领导的改革英国赢得下届大选，这位民粹主义领导人将干涉央行的独立性。【原文：Nigel Farage suggested he would replace Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey if he became prime minister, in a signal the populist leader would interfere in the central bank’s independence if his Reform UK wins the next election.】

item.title: 了解美国对俄罗斯石油的最新制裁措施
item.description: 美国政府于 10 月 22 日制裁了俄罗斯最大的两家原油生产商，这震惊了能源市场。现在，所有人都在关注制裁将如何影响全球石油的供应和价格。【原文：The US government jolted energy markets when it sanctioned Russia’s two biggest crude oil producers on Oct. 22. All eyes are now on how the sanctions will affect the supply and price of petroleum across the world.】

item.title: 铁矿石面临的压力与日俱增 100 美元支撑看似岌岌可危
item.description: 由于需求前景不明，中国钢厂利润承压，铁矿石下滑。【原文：Iron ore slipped as Chinese steel mill profits come under pressure amid an uncertain outlook for demand.】

item.title: 报告称中国对食品配送公司的质量控制进行调查
item.description: 据《经济观察报》报道，中国国家市场监管总局走访了中国主要送餐平台的办公室，作为对其经营行为调查的一部分。【原文：China’s State Administration for Market Regulation has visited the offices of the country’s leading food-delivery platforms as part of an investigation into their practices, according to a report by the Economic Observer.】

item.title: 中国商务部长称中美可以找到解决方案
item.description: 中国商务部长对与美国的会谈持乐观态度，称北京和华盛顿可以在两国关键贸易谈判之前找到解决方案。【原文：China’s Commerce Minister struck an optimistic tone on talks with the US, saying Beijing and Washington can find solutions ahead of key trade negotiations between the two countries.】

item.title: 东京燃气签署协议，探索从阿拉斯加项目购买液化天然气
item.description: 在美国总统访问日本的前几天，东京燃气公司（Tokyo Gas Co.【原文：Tokyo Gas Co. has signed a preliminary agreement to explore buying liquefied natural gas from a long-stalled project in Alaska that has been championed by Donald Trump, days ahead of a visit by the US president to Japan.】

item.description:
瓦塔拉的主要竞争对手被禁止参加投票

item.title: 民调显示欧洲央行未来两年将把利率维持在2%水平
item.description: 根据彭博社对经济学家的调查，欧洲央行将在 2027 年前把欧元区借贷成本维持在 2% 的水平。【原文：The European Central Bank will keep euro-zone borrowing costs at 2% through 2027, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists.】
